subject: Programming
title: Toyota's Unintended Acceleration
description: Learn Toyota's Unintended Acceleration in one minute.

hook.text: Starting in 2009, Toyota cars began accelerating on their own. Over 89 people died.

buildup.text: Toyota initially blamed floor mats and sticky pedals, denying any software involvement.

discovery.text: Expert analysis found spaghetti code with 10,000 global variables and no fail-safe architecture.

twist.text: The code lacked basic protections. A single bit flip could trigger unintended full throttle.

climax.text: Toyota paid over $1.2 billion in settlements and recalled millions of vehicles worldwide.

punchline.text: Ten thousand global variables cost lives and billions.

quiz.question: What did expert analysis find in Toyota's software?
